  • Method Details

    • giveNumbers

      public int[] giveNumbers(int amount) throws IOException
      Description copied from class: ExternalRandomnessProvider
      Provides random 32-bit signed integers.
      Specified by:
      giveNumbers in class ExternalRandomnessProvider
      Parameters:
      amount - How many random numbers to provide. Ought to be positive. May use 0, but that's pointless.
      Returns:
      An array with as many integers as specified by amount.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there is any problem connecting to the Internet to get the random numbers.

    • giveNumbers

      public int[] giveNumbers(int amount, int minimum, int maximum)
      Description copied from class: ExternalRandomnessProvider
      Provides random numbers in a specified range.
      Specified by:
      giveNumbers in class ExternalRandomnessProvider
      Parameters:
      amount - How many random numbers to provide. Ought to be positive.
      minimum - The minimum each number can be. Ought to be less than maximum. For example, 1.
      maximum - The maximum each number can be. Ought to be more than minimum. For example, 10.
      Returns:
      An array with as many integers as specified by amount.

    • haveNotExceededQuota

      public boolean haveNotExceededQuota()
      Tells whether or not the quota has been exceeded.
      Specified by:
      haveNotExceededQuota in class ExternalRandomnessProvider
      Returns:
      False always. Even if the primary's quota has been exceeded, the quota for the fallback should never be exceeded.
